channel.title: Opening Document on UGENE Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Opening Document on UGENE Documentation

item.title: Opening Document Present in Project
item.description:
Opening a Document Present in the Project

To open a document that is already present in the current project, select it in the Project View and press Enter, double-click on it, or drag it to an empty space in the UGENE window.

item.title: Opening Several Documents
item.description:
Opening Several Documents

To open several documents that are not yet present in the current project, use the File â€£ Open item in the main menu. The Select files to open dialog will appear. Select the documents using the Ctrl button and click on the Open button. The following dialog will appear:

Select the reading options and click on the OK button.

item.title: Opening Unloaded Documents
item.description:
Opening Unloaded Documents

The [unloaded] prefix indicates that the document is unloaded:

To open an unloaded document, use the Load selected document context menu, press the Enter key, or double click on the document. To unload the document, use the corresponding context menu item.

item.title: Opening from Clipboard
item.description:
Opening from Clipboard

In UGENE, you can open text data and files by pasting them into the Project View from the clipboard.

Select text data in a browser or a text editor, or select file(s) from your system and press Ctrl+C (Cmd+C for macOS).

Switch to UGENE with an open project, click the project area, and press Ctrl+V (Cmd+V).

The copied data or file(s) will be opened in UGENE.

Another way to open file(s) is by drag and drop. Using your mouse, drag and drop the files from the file system to UGENE, and they will be opened by the program.
